content.description:
Climbs along the lip of the roof then angles up left through a bulge to the giant cobble. Starts out on the ledge to the right. Shares an anchor on the ledge with

The Vultures are Waiting

.

Green hangers.
content.location: Start at the belay bolt out on the ledge to the right of the belay platforms.

content.description: Route starts on highest belay pad on the left and has red and tan hangers. The route is mostly vertical at the start and climbs generally up and right. After climbing the cobble crack for a bit, it then trends up and right to the giant cobble on the arete which you get to surmount.   Lower from the anchor or belay your partner up and give them the lead on the sloppy second.
content.protection: 6 or 7 bolts to a 2 bolt anchor.
content.location: Farthest route to the left. Uphill from the roof. Above the third belay pad.

content.description:
This is the second pitch to all the other routes on the wall. It climbs loose rock and ledges to the summit.  Worth it for the cool top out.

one 70m rope will just make it all the way to the ground. Otherwise make two rappels.

Enjoy...
content.location:
Top out pitch. Start at the anchor for

Vultures are Waiting

or

Wave of Imitation

.

content.description:
8 bolts and 2 Fixe ring anchors. Pumpy. The rock on the first two bolts is much softer than the rest of the route.

You can continue past the anchor on

Wave of Imitation

.
content.location: Above first belay platform; Rasta hangers.

content.description:
Steep and sustained climbing with good holds. Fun route.

You can extend the pitch and add a second pitch to the summit with more  quickdraws and slings.
content.location: Left of two steep routes. Above second belay platform.
